TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WebEventFormatter extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Formats ASP.NET health monitoring event information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ASP.NET health monitoring allows production and operations staff to manage deployed Web applications. The <xref:System.Web.Management> namespace contains the health-event types responsible for packaging application health-status data and the provider types responsible for processing this data. It also contains supporting types that help during the management of health events.
The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter> is a supporting type used to uniformly format event-related information, which is useful if the event data must be logged and later presented to the user.
Instances of the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter> class are passed as arguments to the formatting methods defined by the health-event types.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter> to format event information. It is mainly intended to show the correct syntax to use. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent/CS/webbaseevent.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent/VB/webbaseevent.vb#17)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AppendLine(string s) cil managed

Docs.param: The string to add to the event information.
Docs.summary: Appends the specified string and a carriage return to the event information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.AppendLine%2A> method allows you to customize the event information by adding your own event-specific data.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.AppendLine%2A> method.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent#20](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent/CS/webbaseevent.cs#20)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent#20](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent/VB/webbaseevent.vb#20)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int IndentationLevel { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.IndentationLevel : int with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the indentation level.
Docs.value: The number of tabs used for the indentation level.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.IndentationLevel%2A> property allows you to control how the event information is indented. The base unit of indentation is defined by the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.TabSize%2A> property. For each indentation level, you increase the indentation one tab.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.IndentationLevel%2A> property.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent/CS/webbaseevent.cs#18)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent/VB/webbaseevent.vb#18)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int TabSize { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.TabSize : int with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the tab size.
Docs.value: The number of spaces in a tab.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.TabSize%2A> property allows you to control the tab size used when writing event information. The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.TabSize%2A> determines the number of spaces per unit of indentation, controlled by <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.IndentationLevel%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.TabSize%2A> property.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent#19](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent/CS/webbaseevent.cs#19)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent#19](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent/VB/webbaseevent.vb#19)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the event information in string format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter> uses an internal <xref:System.Text.StringBuilder> variable to store the event information. This <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.ToString%2A> method allows you to get all the information in a string format.
